title: 'I’m sad. Broken. Hurt.': Celebrities grieve the death of John Witherspoon
text:
USA TODAY

John Witherspoon is being remembered by his fellow celebrities.

The death of the actor-comedian with memorable roles in the "Friday" films, "The Boondocks" and many other projects during his decades-spanning career was confirmed Tuesday by manager Alex Goodman. He was 77.

Ice Cube, who played Witherspoon's onscreen son, Craig, in 1995's "Friday" feature in addition to follow-up films, tweeted he was incredibly sad about the news.

"I’m devastated over the passing of John Witherspoon. Life won’t be as funny without him," the musician tweeted, along with a picture of the pair.

'Friday’ actor-comedian John Witherspoon dies at 77

Regina King, who portrayed Ice Cube's sister in "Friday," and Witherspoon's grandchildren in the animated "The Boondocks" series, wished for her former co-star to "Rest In Paradise, King."

"My dad, my grandpa, my comedic inspiration!" she exclaimed. "I love you Spoons!"

Marlon Wayans mourned Witherspoon in a heartfelt Instagram tribute. On "The Wayans Bros." series, which Marlon starred in with his brother Shawn, Witherspoon played their father, John "Pops" Williams.

"I’m sad. Broken. Hurt.. yet extremely grateful to God that i got to spend 5 years of my life working with one of the funniest sweetest wisest humblest loving man @johnnywitherspoon," Wayans wrote in the caption of a black and white photo of the stars. "you were my tv dad and my mentor and my friend. I miss you already.

"Something don’t feel right. This is heavy on my heart," he continued. "Anyone that knows me knows how much i love pops."

"Pure funny. Hilarious and always kind," filmmaker Judd Apatow wrote. "John Witherspoon will be missed."

Jackée Harry posted a clip with her fellow actor.

"I’m absolutely shattered at the news of my great friend John Witherspoon passing," she shared. "May love surround his entire family and fan base - a comedy legend we’ll never forget."

David Alan Grier grieved his friend.

"RIP my brother. You will be missed," he posted on Twitter. "Mannnnnnn this is a hard one."

Vivica A. Fox shared with followers that the news had her feeling "SOO SAD."

"PRAYERS UP TO HIS FAMILY!" she added.

"This day began with such joy. And it’s ending with this heart wrenching news of John Witherspoon’s passing," tweeted Arsenio Hall. "One of our comic brothers."

Contributing: The Associated Press.
description: John Witherspoon is being remembered by his fellow stars. The actor-comedian who memorably appeared in the "Friday" films has died at 77.
